title: 5 Helpful Nail Art Hacks We Learnt From The Internet
text:
facebook 
The Internet is a vast abyss that has something for everyone. While not everything on the Internet can be deemed helpful, appropriate, or sane in any manner, there has been a lot of stuff discovered here that has made life better. And one such helpful Internet discovery has been beauty hacks. While we're not equating this to something life-altering, it did make things like difficult make-up techniques and DIY nail art way easier to access and learn. Here are five of our favourite Internet-approved nail art hacks that have made home manicures so much easier. Using scotch tape to achieve perfect lines 
While we've always known how useful it is to keep scotch tape handy, we only started appreciating its worth when it become an indispensible nail art tool. From helping you create negative space manicures to criss-cross designs, or even just a straight line, we can't imagine life without a roll of tape in our nail polish bag. A post shared by catdelgado_nails (@catdelgado_nails) on Jul 15, 2016 at 8:38am PDT Using bobby pins to create perfectly round polka dotted manicures 
Never would we have imagined using our old, ignored bobby pins to get a cute, polka dotted manicure. What we would struggle to achieve with brushes was actually way easier with this simple, easily available hair accessory, and we can never un-see its purpose. For more easy non tool nail art ideas, bobby pin nail art, scotch tape nailart visit Crazy Nailzz blog page. Learn how to make gorgeous nailart without any tools but just scotch tape and bobby pin with this tutorial by @thenailtrail #nailart #nails #easynailart #easynailarttutorials #scotchtapenails #scotchtape #bobbypinsnailart #bobbypinnailart #bobbypins #nailartvids #nailarttutorial #nailartdiy #diynails #beginnersnailart #crazynailzz #crazynailzzblog A post shared by Crazy Nailzz (@crazy.nailzz) on May 25, 2016 at 12:03pm PDT Using glue to not only prevent nail polish from getting on your fingers, but also to get glitter nail polish off your nails easily 
We've always loved glue (owing to the fact that we used to smear it all over our hands, and peel it off, as kids), and when it comes to nail art, glue is a super helpful tool. Putting it around your nails helps preventing nail polish from getting on your fingers. Plus, have you ever tried getting glitter nail polish off your nails? It's a pain. But not with glue helping you. Use it as a base coat, and apply your glitter nail polish over, to make it easier for you to remove - by just peeling it off. A post shared by Nail Polish Tutorials On Break (@nailpolish7233) on Mar 21, 2015 at 12:42pm PDT Using ice water to make your nails dry faster 
Another amazing Internet discovered nail art hack is to help your nails dry faster by dunking them in a bowl full of water and ice. No more blowing on your nails, or holding them under the fan. This is a much easier, and slightly less funny looking way to do it. A post shared by Nail Polish Tutorials On Break (@nailpolish7233) on Jan 22, 2015 at 6:47pm PST Using a make-up sponge to make gradient or ombre nail art 
One of the hardest nail art designs to achieve, gradient or ombre nails, were made unimaginably easy with the use of make-up sponges. Just paint on your desired colours of nail polish, stamp it onto your nail, and voila! A post shared by Nail Polish Tutorials On Break (@nailpolish7233) on Feb 8, 2015 at 2:40pm PST Lead image credit: Pinterest
